brief_summary.textblock:
This study is a randomized clinical trial comparing outcomes of Integrated Cognitive
      Behavioral Treatment plus standard medications for veterans with both substance use
      disorders, depressive disorders versus the most commonly administered form of therapy for
      substance use disorders and depression, Twelve Step Facilitation (AA/NA model) group
      treatment plus medications.

clinical_study.brief_title: Integrated Intervention for Substance Abusers With Depressive Disorders

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is a randomized clinical trial comparing outcomes of Integrated Cognitive
      Behavioral Treatment plus standard medications for veterans with both substance use
      disorders, depressive disorders versus the most commonly administered form of therapy for
      substance use disorders and depression, Twelve Step Facilitation (AA/NA model) group
      treatment plus medications. Follow-up assessments were conducted at quarterly intervals for
      one year following treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Veterans age 18 and older with alcohol, cannabinol, and/or stimulant dependence and
        independent mood disorders will be included.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Psychotic disorders

intervention.description: Twelve Step Facilitation Therapy involves focusing on topics from 12-Step programs which support sobriety goals and personal growth.
Integrated Cognitive Behavioral Treatment involves focusing on thoughts, activities, and interactions with people related to depressive symptoms and/or substance use.

facility.name: VA San Diego Healthcare System, San Diego

clinical_study.official_title: Integrated Intervention for Substance Abusers With Depressive Disorders

overall_official.affiliation: VA San Diego Healthcare System, San Diego

primary_outcome.measure: Hamilton Depression Scale, Timeline Follow-back (substance measure)

reference.citation: Brown SA, Glasner-Edwards SV, Tate SR, McQuaid JR, Chalekian J, Granholm E. Integrated cognitive behavioral therapy versus twelve-step facilitation therapy for substance-dependent adults with depressive disorders. J Psychoactive Drugs. 2006 Dec;38(4):449-60.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

results_reference.citation: Drapkin ML, Tate SR, McQuaid JR, Brown SA. Does initial treatment focus influence outcomes for depressed substance abusers? J Subst Abuse Treat. 2008 Oct;35(3):343-50. Epub 2008 Mar 4.

Glasner-Edwards S, Tate SR, McQuaid JR, Cummins K, Granholm E, Brown SA. Mechanisms of action in integrated cognitive-behavioral treatment versus twelve-step facilitation for substance-dependent adults with comorbid major depression. J Stud Alcohol Drugs. 2007 Sep;68(5):663-72.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
clinical_study.why_stopped:
PI has been contacted numerous times for an update, with no response. ORD requested a close
    out of this project. 10/2011
